Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2011006199.CaseDesc: Clifford Scruton, age 48, was known to frequent the downtown area of Kitchener and was of no fixed address. He would attend downtown medical centres and withdrawal management for drug and alcohol abuse. Mr. Scruton was last seen in mid-July 2003 at the Downtown Health Centre in Kitchener, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000055.CaseDesc: Ronald Donelle has been missing since November 16, 2001. He was last seen dropping off his ex-wife in front of her home located in the Pierrefonds-Roxboro district in Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle has not been located.

Case reference: 2012020092.CaseDesc: Edward Keith Geddes was last seen sometime mid April, 2011, in the community of Neilburg, Saskatchewan. Mr. Geddes has been known to travel between Manitoba and British Columbia, and has been employed in the auto repair industry. Mr. Geddes does not have a vehicle associated to him as he was known to buy and sell vehicles on a regular basis.

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2016068159.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1968, the skeletonized remains of what is believed to be a male individual was found on the Georgian Bay shoreline in Culvert's Dump, 6 miles southeast of Tobermory, Bruce County. The appendix was present. It is believed that he had been in the water for no less than 2 years before discovery.

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Case reference: 2012020652.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1995, at 3:38 p.m. this unknown male was the victim of a train accident. He may have been in Kamloops, BC, at Padova City Resorts Inc., as he was in possession of one of their T-shirts. His travelling partner stated that the unknown male had said his name was Brian and he was from Ontario. The unknown male was very conscious of his personal hygiene as he always wanted to be clean shaven and neat in his appearance.

Case reference: 2022007268.CaseDesc: On February 18, 2022, Brayden Ferrall was seen for the last time in Brantford, Ontario. His disappearance is out of character, and police suspect foul play.

Case reference: 2015035404.CaseDesc: On the morning of June 27, 2015, Curtis Wilson was seen for the last time by a friend in Kelowna, British Columbia. Mr. Wilson had travelled from Alberta to British Columbia in a black rental car, model Chrysler 200. Subsequently, the rental was recovered in an area off Cosen Bay in the Kalamakla Provincial Park in Coldstream, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2017045625.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1997, the skeletal remains of a man were found in a wooded area in Notre-Dame-de-Porneuf, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006004699.CaseDesc: On 13 July 1992, William Aman left the shore of Lake Ontario to go fishing.  His boat was later found with his ball cap 3.2 kilometers off of Pete's Point, Lake Ontario. Mr. Aman has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014003631.CaseDesc: Xiu Zi Lin was last seen on February 3, 1998 in Montreal. Ms. Lin came from China with no documentation or family. She was placed in a shelter. She left the center without giving a new address.

Case reference: 2014004085.CaseDesc: On December 27, 1999, Simon Farah was seen for the last time at his residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Simon was suffering from mental health issues. He has not been seen and has not given any news to his family, which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 2014004721.CaseDesc: Belinda Gertrude Williams was last seen by her sister and father in July 1976 in Vancouver. Ms. Williams was not reported missing until February 2004 to the Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police in Mt. Currie, BC.  Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police determined that Ms. Williams was last seen in Mission, BC.

Case reference: 2014005249.CaseDesc: Peter Cory Butler was reported missing by family on March 24, 2008. He was last seen in downtown Whitecourt, AB on March 15, 2008.

Case reference: 2014003679.CaseDesc: In December 1983, Konrad Murach was last seen by his family. Since this time, Konrad has not been seen nor has anyone heard from him.

Case reference: 2016061229.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1973, a male individual was found on the GO Train tracks near Roncesvalles and the Gardiner, beneath the Sunnyside Walkway, from which he apparently fell/jumped. His post-mortem length was 5’5"-5’8", but due to extensive bone fractures this may not accurately reflect his height. His appendix was not present.

Case reference: 2013000087.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1993, Alan Curtis was seen for the last time during a visit to his uncle’s home in Montreal, Quebec. He was to take a flight from Mirabel airport to go home to British Columbia. He never arrived at his destination.

Case reference: 2012020111.CaseDesc: On July 15 2010, James Daniel Khan left the family home for a walk and never returned. He suffers from mental health problems and he left without his medication.

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.

Case reference: 2014006416.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2014, at approximately 10:15 a.m., Richard Hicks was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003729.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1997, Céline Mercier was seen for the last time at her home in Levis, Quebec. Her vehicle was recovered near the Pierre-Laporte Bridge, which spans the cities of Levis and Quebec. Céline hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020029.CaseDesc: Julie Derouin was reported missing to Lethbridge Police in June of 1983. There have been no confirmed sightings of Julie since January 1, 1980. Police investigations continue.

Case reference: 2012020079.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1991, Lavina Tocher, 35 years old, was last seen in Parkman, SK. On the 12th of December of that year, Ms. Tocher was reported missing by an anonymous caller. Investigation and searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2019061160.CaseDesc: The body of this young to middle-aged male was found in September 2019 near Merritt, British Columbia. He had brown hair, a muscular build and no obvious scars or tattoos. The RCMP are investigating this as a suspicious death.

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2014004478.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004, Norman Halkett was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2006011699.CaseDesc: Justin Pollari is from St. Joseph Island, Ontario, and was last seen on Friday, December 7, 2001. He is known to be an avid skateboarder and may frequent areas where this sport is practised.

Case reference: 2014002202.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1991, Doctor Jitinkumar Devchand Karamshi Shah, a physician with Sir Thomas Roddick Hospital in Stephenville, Newfoundland, was last seen at 2:45 in the morning. After a night out at a local club, Dr. Shah dropped a friend off at their residence and continued walking home. Dr. Shah was born in Nairobi, Kenya and previously lived and worked in Sheffield, England.

Case reference: 2006001899.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1992, a male was found on the lawn of the Metropolitan United Church, near Queen Street and Church Street in Toronto.

Case reference: 2021009119.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2021, Amber Ellis was reported missing by her mother. Amber communicated with her friends and family, including her two children, on a regular basis prior to her disappearance. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Case reference: 2014002983.CaseDesc: On the 14th of June, 1986, Joseph MAJOR, 75 years old, was reported missing from a care home in the Hudson Bay district, SK. Extensive ground searches of the area failed to locate Mr. MAJOR.

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018000902.CaseDesc: Daniel Harvey was seen for the last time on December 28, 2017 in the Bellerive district of Montreal, Quebec. None of Daniel's personal items were missing from his apartment.

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Case reference: 2008002499.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1983, three men were doing some repairs to a dock at the cottage when they heard a male voice shouting "Help" three times approximately 5 seconds apart. All three witnesses observed a boat turning in circles. Two of the men ran to their boat and went to the out-of-control boat. They found the boat unattended. They were unable to locate the victim, Robert Kennedy. The boat ran ashore and Mr. Kennedy has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006021099.CaseDesc: Roy Britten was last seen in a 14-foot aluminum boat in the Birch Beach area heading toward the northeast part of Caribou Island, Lake Superior, Ontario.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014004635.CaseDesc: In 1986, Sarah Skunk visited with family members located in Mishkeegogamang First Nation and Shabaqua, ON. Since that time, she has not been heard from by any family members. Family fears that she may be deceased. Sarah was known to frequent Vancouver BC, Sudbury ON, and Washington State, USA. Sarah spent some time on the streets. She was known by numerous aliases and may have had children.

Case reference: 2014005512.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2010, Ivana Ferus was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario, to catch a flight destined for the Czech Republic. Ivana’s apartment keys were subsequently found in a recycling bin.

Case reference: 2014005327.CaseDesc: Edward Tandrup was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in February of 1983. Edward Tandrup may have been hitchiking to Vancouver, BC at the time.

Case reference: 2014005273.CaseDesc: Elaine Frieda Alook was last seen on May 11, 2004, on Tower road, outside of Fort McMurray, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003733.CaseDesc: Gaétan Anglehart was last seen in a brewery with friends on June 2, 1975, in Montreal, Quebec. That night, Gaétan was seen being forced into a Cadillac vehicle.

Case reference: 2014005355.CaseDesc: In November of 1990, Jose Valdez was last seen by a friend at his residence located in Edmonton, Alberta. Jose has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2018026641.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1991, the body of an adult Asian male was found in the Burrard Inlet, British Columbia. He was slim and healthy, with no tattoos and his teeth were in good condition. It is believed he was deceased for only one or two days prior to his body being recovered.

Case reference: 2021053826.CaseDesc: On November 14, 2021, Lawrence Miller was seen for the last time in Holtyre, Ontario. Lawrence’s cats and dog were left unattended at this residence, which was out of character for him, and his all terrain vehicle was subsequently located in a nearby trail.

Case reference: 2008008198.CaseDesc: Gerald Hart was last seen at around midnight on Christmas Eve on Symmes St, travelling on foot towards Main St in the City of Niagara Falls (the casino district).  Mr. Hart was reported to have been in an intoxicated state.

Case reference: 2014005974.CaseDesc: Éric Descoteaux's relatives have had no news of him since January, 2009. Mr. Descoteaux lived in the town of Harrington in the Laurentians.  He left there without warning, and stopped contacting his relatives.

Case reference: 2014005938.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Mashia Rezadoust was seen for the last time by her father in Toronto, Ontario. Mashia was taken to China by her mother, but has never returned.

Case reference: 2021011416.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2021, Solange Bergeron was seen for the last time as she was drifting uncontrollably in the St. Lawrence River, near the Laviolette Park, in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance, Solange was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006002699.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1996, a male was found in a field 50m north of Lakeshore Boulevard and 200m west of Spadina Avenue in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured to be 5'8"-5'9" however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Staining of his teeth suggests that he may have been a smoker. He is estimated to have died a few weeks to months prior to his discovery.

Case reference: 2014003025.CaseDesc: On March 5, 1989, Barbara McLaughlin was last seen leaving a friends residence in Roseville, Michigan in the USA.  A few days later Barbara's car was discovered on the Bluewater Bridge in Sarnia, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019055061.CaseDesc: Yannick Bastien went missing on September 21, 2019.  Yannick's vehicle and kayak were located at Lake Minnewanka, Alberta and he has not been located.

Case reference: 2009004799.CaseDesc: Neil McDougall left Three-Way Demolition in Durham on Friday, October 11, 1985 with a co-worker and went home. He had an argument with his wife and the friend left. After supper Mr. McDougall went to Ayton, to the Commercial Hotel. He left the hotel with someone else and they met up elsewhere with the co-worker.  Mr. McDougall returned to the hotel and left at closing time, between 1:30 – 1:40 am. He was last reported leaving a residence on Edmund Street, Ayton at 2 a.m. October 12, 1985. His pickup truck was discovered near Ayton later that day. The ashtray was filled with different brands of cigarette butts. He has been described as meticulous, habitual, responsible and hardworking. When he went missing, Neil was planning to adopt his wife's children. Foul play is suspected. Mr. McDougall was declared legally dead in 1996.

Case reference: 2017009362.CaseDesc: Badri Prasad Bhattarai, was reported missing on February 21, 2017, after his family became concerned that he had not been in contact with them. It is believed that Mr. Bhattarai’s last known location was in the area of the Walterdale Bridge, Edmonton. Mr. Bhattarai’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being.

Case reference: 2006005999.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1994, the body of a male was found in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 120 lbs and his length was measured approximately 5’8"-5’9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days to several weeks.

Case reference: 2014003896.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, at approximately 3:30 p.m., Johanne Couture was seen for the last time when she left the Hôtel-Dieu Hospital in Lévis, Quebec. The following day, Johanne’s purse was found in the Chaudière Falls Park in Lévis.

Case reference: 2014003840.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1986, a male was seen floating in the river. The male initially responded to police calls however shortly after he was observed going under the water. It is presumed he drowned. The identity of the male was unknown to police until Roderick Cook's parents contacted police advising they had not seen their son for some time. It is assumed the man in the river was Roderick based both on the description and the fact that he was seen walking near the river. Police further found footprints that led from the shore to the open water. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is assumed Mr. Cook drowned.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2021015231.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 1:06 p.m., James Ryding was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, James may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2014002585.CaseDesc: Mario Levasseur was last seen leaving the family home on December 1, 1983, in Levis, Quebec.

Case reference: 2005003599.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2002, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem length was 5’5" and his weight was 114lbs., however, due to the condition of the body, this is an underestimate and he weighed more in life. It is estimated that he was in the water for weeks to months.

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004965.CaseDesc: Cecilia Nikal arrived in Vancouver to visit her mother on August 1, 1989; she then left her mother's house to live on the streets. She was last seen by her mother in October of 1989. A report by a family member that Ms. Nikal had subsequently moved to Vancouver Island was never confirmed.

Case reference: 2020006272.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1962, at approximately midnight, Francis Tan was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Francis had left his home with two other men.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Case reference: 2015011633.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2000, a man's body was recovered in the middle of the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in Pointe-aux-Trembles. According to experts, the body was not in the water for a long time.

Case reference: 2009001499.CaseDesc: Louis Riklik was last seen on October 12, 2008, in the Toronto area. On October 19, 2008, Mr. Riklik entered the Bruce Peninsula National Park. His vehicle, a blue 2003 Mazda minivan, was located at the Halfway Log Dump Road parking lot. This is an access point to the Bruce trail. An extensive ground, air and water search was conducted by the OPP, Mr. Riklik was not found.

Case reference: 2014004010.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1993, Howard Metacat was last seen in Indian Cabins, Alberta. Howard was hunting alone along the Hay River, 6 miles north of Indian Cabins and wandered away from his campsite in the early morning hours of September 17, 1993.

Case reference: 2014002754.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 1963, Charles Williams was seen operating a 12' outboard motorboat in coastal waters and did not return home.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2019019954.CaseDesc: On April 14, 2019, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Yonis and Mawahib Ahmed were seen for the last time with their mother Liyana Abdow at the Sojourn House in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009002799.CaseDesc: Terry Zubko was a resident of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario and had been a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. Terry left the hospital on July 21, 1982, at 10:00 AM. It is unknown what his diagnosis was at the time, however, reports indicate he suffers from amnesia that requires medication. He was last seen at the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital (which became the Northeast Mental Health Centre, before being torn down in 2013)

Case reference: 2014006086.CaseDesc: Martin Geoffrion was last seen on April 26, 2013 in Montreal. He left his home around 4:00 pm in a Mercedes vehicle. On April 30, 2013, the Mercedes was located in a cul-de-sac in St-Roch de l'Achigan. According to his relatives, Mr. Geoffrion was not suicidal. He loved fishing and playing golf.

Case reference: 2006002299.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1995, remains from an unidentified man were discovered in Grenadier Pond, also known as “Duck Pond”, in High Park in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000012.CaseDesc: Cameron March was last seen by his mother on May 7, 1975, at approximately 3:15 p.m. He was playing on a swing set in a next door neighbour's yard located on Blind Line in the City of Burlington, Ontario. Cameron followed the adult neighbour into the residence and asked to play with a friend. When told the friend was sleeping, Cameron left the residence, walking towards his house.

Case reference: 2016061134.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from Lakewood Beach, Lake Erie in Malden Township of Amherstburg. He was estimated to have been there for 1-3 years. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5’7"-5’8", however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Case reference: 2022006239.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1990, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Vincent Stack was seen for the last time by his family members leaving his residence in Buffalo, New York. Vincent’s vehicle was located abandon in a parking lot near Niagara Falls State Park in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Case reference: 2020008878.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1979, Joseph Vetere was seen for the last time in the area of 1061, Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014035917.CaseDesc: On October 14, 2014, Steven Hector Gravel was reported missing from North Bay, Ontario by his mother. Family members and friends have not seen nor heard from him since December 2000.

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Case reference: 2014003432.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1979, June Johnson was driven by a friend to the Marlboro Hotel in Prince Albert.  June has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019035278.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1982, the remains of a male were found on the banks of Bouchard Island, near Saint-Sulpice, Quebec.

Case reference: 2012020046.CaseDesc: On January, 17, 2008, Bradley Worobeck left his place of employment in downtown Calgary and went to a pub that was also in downtown Calgary. That was the last time anyone saw or heard from Bradley.

Case reference: 2021056657.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, skeletal remains were recovered from a lobster trap off the coast of Bay Roberts in Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2014004308.CaseDesc: Joseph Laboucan was last seen in Peace River, Alberta, on or around August 10, 1988. He lived on the streets in Peace River and Little Buffalo, Alberta. He made occasional trips around the area as far as Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014004475.CaseDesc: On the morning of October 1, 1976, Crystal Van Huuksloot was seen for the last time with her suitcases in Toronto, Ontario. Crystal had traveled from Edmonton, Alberta to help raise funds for her boyfriend. She stayed in Toronto for one week, but did not board her return flight to Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2014001414.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1967, Sarah Ovayuak was last seen as she fell into the Tuktoyaktuk Harbour while trying to board a Coast Guard vessel.

Case reference: 2013000004.CaseDesc: John Wade left his parents’ home in Halifax, NS on June 17, 2012. He left on foot while distraught, leaving behind his identification, bank card and money. He has been known to reside on the streets and does have connections to Edmonton, AB. Mr. Wade has previously hitchhiked across Canada. He suffers with mental illness and is diagnosed with schizophrenia.
